126.sentence: Though nearly a dozen different people at both T-Mobile and Nokia have told me otherwise, it is simply not possible to use this phone as a Bluetooth modem for the vast majority of PDAs and many other devices.

127.sentence: Only then did I learn the truth -- THIS PHONE DOES NOT WORK WITH PALM PDAS!

128.sentence: This simple nuance was too much for Nokia, and they still refuse to acknoledge the fact that their technician could have broken the phone or repair the phone for free.

129.sentence: In short - Nokia themselves don't know that this phone doesn't work with the Palm, and if you don't heed my advice you will spend hours with technicians around the globe reading from scripts, chiding you in broken english for not following their directions exactly.

284.sentence: On occasion I'm not able to connect to the phone with iSync via Bluetooth but I found that rebooting the phone seems to solve this problem.

285.sentence: And Bluetooth does not drain the battery as quick as I thought it would, I usually can go 1.5 days with Bluetooth on along with making calls before I need a full recharge.

286.sentence: And Bluetooth does not drain the battery as quick as I thought it would, I usually can go 1.5 days with Bluetooth on along with making calls before I need a full recharge.

287.sentence: With Bluetooth off the phone last almost twice as long.

288.sentence: The nokia 6600 is a great phone, good games, good camera.

289.sentence: The video recorders a bit odd, sometimes I get 9 secs on my recordings, sometimes I get 17.

290.sentence: The voice recorders good, but you can't record songs off the radio for ring tones.

291.sentence: The games are decent, but u only get 2 to start off with.

292.sentence: But you can download some really good ones like pac-man or mafia wars.

293.sentence: Overall the phones fantastic, and I would have given it 5 stars, but its not perfect.

294.sentence: The battery on mine lasts 2 days if I don't play games that much, and it only takes 90 mins to charge from flat.

295.sentence: This phone has the best battery, it lasts longer then my old 3210

296.sentence: I got a 1GB MMC upgrade for this phone and now I can:

297.sentence: 1. Record around 1 hour of video with Phillips Camcorder Pro.

301.sentence: 5. Check traffic411.com for LA traffic on the 405.

302.sentence: 6. Play Gameboy Color games on it with GoBoy.

303.sentence: 7. Have a good chunk of my small MP3 to listen through the speaker phone.

304.sentence: 8. Connected the phone to my tablet pc and now can access company VPN at 56k speed via bluetooth.

305.sentence: Clear the call logs once in a while to speed up the phone people!!!

306.sentence: As for bluetooth, no problems at all.

307.sentence: I've connected the phone with two laptops and a iPaq 4155.

309.sentence: This is the first cell phone I've owned, and overall, I am quite pleased with it.

310.sentence: Among my requirments for a phone were: good screen, decent camera, bluetooth, and GPRS support.

311.sentence: The 6600 was the best phone I could find with these options that I could get with t-mobile.

312.sentence: The 6600 was the best phone I could find with these options that I could get with t-mobile.

313.sentence: One primary reason for getting a cell phone was so that I could use it as an internet connection for my laptop running linux, where softmodem drivers are hard to find, and don't work very well.

314.sentence: If you are using Linux, and you want to use GPRS to connect to the net, I suggest this phone along with a Belkin USB Bluetooth adapter.

315.sentence: I have really enjoyed the camera on this phone.

316.sentence: Although the images are not the best in the world, its very handy to have a camera everywhere you go.

317.sentence: Although the images are not the best in the world, its very handy to have a camera everywhere you go.

318.sentence: And the phone has a very cool feature wich allows you to send images via a normal POP3/SMTP e-mail account.

319.sentence: I will also say that setting up the e-mail account was very simple and straight-forward, although you do need an external SMTP server to use.

320.sentence: The phone can use any MIDI audio file as a ringtone.

321.sentence: Which is really nice because you can get pretty much any piece of music in MIDI format for free on the net.

322.sentence: Which is really nice because you can get pretty much any piece of music in MIDI format for free on the net.

323.sentence: You can use the OBEX File Transfer service with bluetooth from linux (KDE-bluetooth provieds a nice intergration into Konqueror for this) for sending files to the phone.

324.sentence: The fact that you can assign ringtones to people and/or groups is really cool.

325.sentence: I will say that the OS that the phone runs does have a few issues.

327.sentence: Especially the bluetooth server... Meaning you have to restart the phone if you want bluetooth to work again.

328.sentence: This is somewhat annoying, but from working with computers (espcially windows -- ugh...)

329.sentence: I really dislike holding a phone to my ear, and I've found the Freespeak to be very comfortable and easy to use with this phone.

330.sentence: The only main drawback is the fact that the voice-dialing system is kinda picky.

331.sentence: It takes a while to learn how to use it right, and at this point I am able to make about 70% of my calls using it.

332.sentence: However, it needs to be quite quiet for it to work at all -- dosn't work at all in the car, for example.

333.sentence: Some people have commented about the size and weight of the phone, and it has rightfully gotten the nick-name "the bar of soap" which, it really is.

334.sentence: Some people have commented about the size and weight of the phone, and it has rightfully gotten the nick-name "the bar of soap" which, it really is.

335.sentence: But if you use all bluetooth accessories, as I do, its really not an issue.

336.sentence: But if you use all bluetooth accessories, as I do, its really not an issue.

337.sentence: All in all, this is a great phone.

338.sentence: Especially for the price amazon gives it at (I was unable to get mine through amazon due to some credit complications).

339.sentence: If you use linux and want GRPS and/or want to use a handsfree bluetooth device, and want a decent camera -- this is the phone for you.

341.sentence: I also am loving T-Mobile (100 times better than ATT...

342.sentence: I also am loving T-Mobile (100 times better than ATT...

343.sentence: you actually can talk to a real person for support in under an hour!).

344.sentence: Have had the Nokia 6600 for a year now and am generally very happy with it and with T-Mobile.

345.sentence: Have had the Nokia 6600 for a year now and am generally very happy with it and with T-Mobile.

346.sentence: It offers way more features than I need but the ones I use work well.

347.sentence: I almost always get a good strong signal, even in fairly remote areas here in the southwest.

348.sentence: The sound quality is excellent and the speaker phone couldn't be easier to use.

349.sentence: The sound quality is excellent and the speaker phone couldn't be easier to use.

350.sentence: I like the size and shape.

351.sentence: I like the size and shape.

352.sentence: It fits comfortably in my hand and pocket.

353.sentence: It fits comfortably in my hand and pocket.

354.sentence: The only problem is the size of the keys.

355.sentence: My fingers are kind of stubby so it took a while to learn how to hit a key without hitting the adjacent ones.

357.sentence: Also the battery life isn't great but it's sufficient for my needs.

358.sentence: It also works just fine for international calls.

359.sentence: It's a bit pricey to call home from other countries but the instant messaging to and from covered countries in Europe are quite reasonable.

360.sentence: It's really well made and has survived sliding across floors and pavement without a scratch.

361.sentence: I've had nothing but good luck with T-Mobile.
